Key Match Events: Indiana scored 66 points in the paint
A 13-0 run midway through the final quarter sealed the game for Indiana
Sam Hauser got Boston on the board with a straightaway three, his first in two weeks
Joe Mazzulla was forced to call his first timeout with his team trailing 12-5
Indiana fired back with a 5-0 run after Boston cut the lead to four
Payton Pritchard drilled a three right before the buzzer to make it a 65-58 halftime deficit
Tatum capped off a 9-0 run after a Tatum and-1 to make it 105-103
Indiana went on a 13-0 run to make it 118-103
Miscellaneous Highlights: Andrew Nembhard proved to be a difference maker
Indiana made six of its first seven shots with every starter scoring besides Bennedict Mathurin
Boston struggled to contain Andrew Nembhard who finished the half with 14 points
Payton Pritchard moved ahead of Avery Bradley for ninth place in all-time three-pointers made in Celtics history
Indiana dominated the paint, scoring 46 of their 89 points from the paint
The Celtics allowed Indiana to score 36 of their 65 points in the paint in the first half
